mymetal.universial.data.dataadjust module

mymetal.universial.data.dataadjust.my_add_list(list1=[], list2=[])

” combine two list, and sort it

mymetal.universial.data.dataadjust.my_down_up(list, move_list_down_up=[0, 0])

enlarge list

like [1,4], move_list = [-2,3]

=>> [-1,0,1,2,3,4,5,6,7] (-1, 7)

mymetal.universial.data.dataadjust.myjust(left=True, num=10, output='')

left just or right just of output

num is digit of variable

like ‘dig’ =>> ‘dig ‘ =>> ‘ dig’

return char_out

mymetal.universial.data.dataadjust.normalize_float_int(value)

Helper function to normalize values

Convert to float and remove trailing zeros, if it’s a float

mymetal.universial.data.dataadjust.rm_blank(extr_content, remove_string=' ', removed_string='')

for 1-D list, remove blank

like [“reached required accuracy”,”reached required accuracy”] to

[ “reachedrequiredaccuracy” , “reachedrequiredaccuracy” ]

mymetal.universial.data.datachange module

mymetal.universial.data.datachange.char_to_dic(mycontent_char)

“name:n1 gender:male” =>> {“name”:”n1”, “gender”:”male”}

mymetal.universial.data.datachange.dic_to_char(mycontent_dic={}, tag='   ')

f”name:n1 {tag} gender:male” <<= {“name”:”n1”, “gender”:”male”}

mymetal.universial.data.datachange.list_to_char(mycontent=[], list_type='char', char_tag='   ', dic_tag='\n', key_value_interval=': ', item_interval=', ')

consisted of two function

list_of_char_to_char to output the list of char to file

list_of_dic_to_char to output the list of dic to file
